entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 3:59AM AKST until December 25 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches along the southern Bristol Bay coast and 4 to 6 inches along the northern Bristol Bay coast. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibilities reduced to as low as 1/2 mile from Dillingham north and west and from Port Heiden to King Salmon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bristol Bay

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 24 at 3:51AM AKST until December 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Northeast winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts as high as 55 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as 1/4 mile in blowing snow. There will not be any new snow for this event, just blowing around of existing snow on the ground.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Matanuska Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 3:07AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK SURFACES AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES POSSIBLE THIS MORNING... Arctic air, light snow showers and strong winds, will maintain dangerous travel conditions anywhere there is still ice and snow on roads and walkways, through this morning. Icy surfaces may be hidden as snow dusts over roads and walkways. In addition, sudden changes in visibility are possible in blowing snow.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 22 at 10:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rapid ice development on waterways may cause ice jam flooding... With Arctic cold temperatures in the forecast, expect rivers and streams across the area to build ice and freeze up.
